ARTICLE.TITLE: The Spin: Lightfoot vs. activists on poverty plan | Ald. Jeanette Taylor has some words for Rahm Emanuel | U.S. Rep. Rush’s anti-lynching legislation heads to Trump’s desk
ARTICLE.TEXT: She added: "People need to step up. What I have said is we are committed to making sure that we solve poverty in our city in a generation. We need an all-hands-on-deck approach. Nobody needs a golden ticket to talk about the fact that one in five of our people are suffering. People are living on $8.50 a day. My goodness. That is a disgrace. If you want to be in on this, step up and lead. That is what people have elected you to do.”
